No Poverty.reason: No explicit mention of poverty, income inequality, or economic vulnerability in relation to real estate analysis.

Quality Education.reason: The course provides higher education, developing 'professional ability' and 'theoretical analysis' in land economics, directly contributing to quality education.
evidence: This course applies statistical methods and economic theory to identify, estimate, and test economic models in the real estate market.
Students will learn how to conduct econometric analysis and critique empirical studies related to the real estate market
具備地政學理之專業能力與國際觀

empirical analysis of the real estate market

gpt_critique.critique: Model B overreaches on SDGs 8, 15, and 17; adjust scores based on syllabus details; 9 and 11 seem reasonable.

SDG_8.reason: Course teaches econometric analysis but does not ensure productive employment or growth policies.

SDG_15.reason: Real estate focus; no explicit life-on-land sustainability components.

SDG_17.reason: Only minor mentions of international perspective; lacks explicit partnerships.

gemini_critique.critique: Model B correctly identified several relevant SDGs that Model A missed, particularly for Quality Education, Decent Work, Industry/Infrastructure, and Sustainable Cities. Model B's nuanced low scores for other SDGs are also more appropriate than Model A's uniform 0.001.
